intro: Impatiens munronii, commonly known as the purple-flowered impatiens, is a species of flowering plant in the family Balsaminaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. This plant is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Impatiens munronii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
